    • Field Detail

      • eventSink

        protected javax.ws.rs.sse.SseEventSink eventSink
        How to talk to the browser that represents this player. If this property remains null the business logic should detect it and not fail. For example, in the case of player robots this value will typically be null and an alternative should be used to trigger the robot.

      • withdrawn

        protected boolean withdrawn
        Whether this player is active in the current round or game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardPlayer

        public CardPlayer(java.lang.String playerName)
        Parameters:
        playerName - The immutable nickname associated with this player for the duration of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • setEventSink

        public CardPlayer setEventSink(javax.ws.rs.sse.SseEventSink eventSink)
        Sets the eventSink protected instance. This SseEventSink can be used to send events unique to this player to the web browser associated with this player. This is not the only mechanism that a CardGame can be used to communicate with a player proxy; other mechanisms can be used in sub-classes.
        Parameters:
        eventSink - a SseEventSink which can be used to send events unique to this player to the web browser associated with this player.
        Returns:
        this instance, suitable for fluent-style programming.

      • getEventSink

        public javax.ws.rs.sse.SseEventSink getEventSink()
        Returns:
        the SseEventSink associated with this player; can be used to send Server-Sent Events to the player's browser

      • getPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        Returns:
        the player's nickname

      • isWithdrawn

        public boolean isWithdrawn()
        Returns:
        true if the player has withdrawn from this game or round, false otherwise.
